bropals.lib.simplegame

Interface GameWindow

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AWTGameWindow, GameApplet, LWJGLGameWindow, TestApplet

    public interface GameWindow
    Represents the drawing window. Can be implemented by multiple types of drawing.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void destroy()
      Destroys the window and all of its used resources.
      void flushInput()
      Process all input that has occurred since the last frame.
      GameCursor getGameCursor()
      Gets the current game cursor.
      java.awt.Point getMousePosition()
      Gets the mouse position in the screen's coordinate space.

      Gets the screen height in pixels.
      ScreenResolution getScreenResolution()
      Gets the screen resolution.
      int getScreenWidth()
      Gets the screen width in pixels.
      ScreenResolution[] getSupportedScreenResolutionList(java.awt.GraphicsDevice device)
      Makes a list of ScreenResolutions that the given graphics device supports.

      For internal use only

    • Method Detail

      • setIcon

        void setIcon(java.awt.image.BufferedImage icon)
        Sets the image icon of this GameWindow.
        Parameters:
        icon - the icon to set it to.

      • supportsResolution

        boolean supportsResolution(int screenWidth,
                           int screenHeight)
        Checks to see if the full screen resolution is supported. If the size does not work for fullscreen, it will still work for a window.
        Parameters:
        screenWidth - the screen width to check
        screenHeight - the screen height to check
        Returns:
        if the resolution is supported

      • supportsResolution

        boolean supportsResolution(ScreenResolution resolution)
        Checks to see if the full screen resolution is supported. If the size does not work for fullscreen, it will still work for a window.
        Parameters:
        resolution - the screen resolution to check
        Returns:
        if the resolution is supported

      • getSupportedScreenResolutionList

        ScreenResolution[] getSupportedScreenResolutionList(java.awt.GraphicsDevice device)
        Makes a list of ScreenResolutions that the given graphics device supports.
        Parameters:
        device - the graphics device
        Returns:
        the list of supported screen resolutions

      • isRequestingToClose

        boolean isRequestingToClose()
        Checks to see if the AWTGameWindow is requesting to close.
        Returns:
        the request to close state.

      • isFullscreen

        boolean isFullscreen()
        Checks to see if the AWTGameWindow is in fullscreen.
        Returns:

      • isWindowed

        boolean isWindowed()
        Checks to see if the AWTGameWindow is in windowed mode.
        Returns:
        the windowed state of the window.

      • setFullscreen

        void setFullscreen(boolean fullscreen)
        Sets the fullscreen state of the AWTGameWindow. Call applyGraphicsConfiguration() to update the fullscreen state.
        Parameters:
        fullscreen - the new fullscreen state.

      • setWindowed

        void setWindowed(boolean windowed)
        Sets the windowed state of the AWTGameWindow. Call applyGraphicsConfiguration() to update the windowed state.
        Parameters:
        windowed - the new windowed state.

      • setScreenResolution

        boolean setScreenResolution(ScreenResolution screenResolution)
        Sets the screen resolution of the AWTGameWindow. Call applyGraphicsConfiguration() to update the fullscreen state. If the screen resolution is not supported, this method returns false.
        Parameters:
        screenResolution - the new screen resolution.
        Returns:
        if the screen change was successful.

      • getGameCursor

        GameCursor getGameCursor()
        Gets the current game cursor. If null then the default system cursor is used.
        Returns:
        the game cursor

      • setGameCursor

        void setGameCursor(GameCursor gameCursor)
        Sets the game cursor. If null then the default system cursor is used.
        Parameters:
        gameCursor - the game cursor

      • getMousePosition

        java.awt.Point getMousePosition()
        Gets the mouse position in the screen's coordinate space. Returns (-1, -1) if the mouse position is not on the screen.
        Returns:
        the mouse position.
